questions.prompt: In BG 13.1, what does Arjuna request?
choices: Battle strategy and worldly philosophical speculation
Explain prakriti (nature) and purusa (spirit); their characteristics
Prophecy and worldly philosophical speculation
Political advice and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Arjuna seeks understanding of the distinction between matter and consciousness.

questions.prompt: According to BG 13.2, what is the field?
choices: The body primarily through independent material processes
This body is called the field
The mind and worldly philosophical speculation
External objects and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: The body is the field of activity; consciousness is the observer.

questions.prompt: In BG 13.3, what is the result of knowing the knower of the field?
choices: Material progress and worldly philosophical speculation
One understands the truth; liberation is achieved
Confusion increases and worldly philosophical speculation
minimal changes and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Understanding the witness self is the key to liberation.

questions.prompt: What does BG 13.4-6 teach about the field?
choices: The field is permanent through independent material processes
It consists of five gross and three subtle elements
It is simple through independent material processes
It is primarily matter through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The field is composed of both gross material and subtle energies.

questions.prompt: According to BG 13.7, what are the twenty-four cosmic elements?
choices: Bodies of demigods through independent material processes
Earth, water, fire, air, sky, mind, intellect, ego five sense organs and five organs of action
primarily physical matter through independent material processes
Non-existent and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: The entire field operates through these natural principles of creation.

questions.prompt: In BG 13.8, what does Krishna teach about humility?
choices: Strength is best through independent material processes
Humility, modesty, harmlessness, patience, and honesty are divine virtues
Pride is good through independent material processes
Rudeness helps and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Divine qualities are built on the foundation of humility.

questions.prompt: What does BG 13.9-10 teach about knowledge of the field?
choices: It is unnecessary through independent material processes
Detachment from material pleasure, unwavering devotion to meditation is knowledge
Attachment is wise through independent material processes
Knowledge of physical phenomena and external forms
questions.feedback: True knowledge emerges from detachment and inward focus.

questions.prompt: According to BG 13.12, what is the ultimate object of knowledge?
choices: The material world through independent material processes
Know that I am the Supreme
Matter is supreme through independent material processes
Spirit does not exist through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Krishna is the ultimate object of all knowledge and understanding.

questions.prompt: In BG 13.13, what does Krishna explain about His manifestation?
choices: I am distant through independent material processes
I am everywhere
I am limited through independent material processes
I am in one place
questions.feedback: Krishna's omnipresence is reflected in infinite divine manifestations.

questions.prompt: What does BG 13.14-15 teach about perceiving Krishna?
choices: He is invisible through independent material processes
Through every senses, yet is beyond the senses; sustains every
He is material through independent material processes
He is dependent through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Krishna is simultaneously transcendental and sustaining all creation.

questions.prompt: According to BG 13.16, what is Krishna's relationship to the field?
choices: He is absent through independent material processes
I am seated in the heart of every the origin, sustenance dissolution
He is created by it
He depends on it through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Krishna is the ultimate ground of all existence and consciousness.

questions.prompt: In BG 13.18, what is the distinction between the field and the knower?
choices: They are identical through independent material processes
All beings are made of the field the knower, eternal and unchanging
The field is conscious through independent material processes
The knower is material through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The eternal soul is distinct from the changing material body.

questions.prompt: What does BG 13.19-23 teach about the modes of nature?
choices: They do not exist through independent material processes
Three modes of nature
every are equal through independent material processes
primarily matter exists through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The modes of nature determine one's perception and actions.

questions.prompt: According to BG 13.25, what is the path to eternal truth?
choices: Material knowledge and worldly philosophical speculation
Some perceive the self within through meditation
primarily one path through independent material processes
Paths do not lead there
questions.feedback: There are many legitimate paths to realizing the Supreme.

questions.prompt: In BG 13.26, what does Krishna teach about suffering?
choices: It is permanent through independent material processes
Know that all beings emerge from me the origin
Creation is eternal through independent material processes
minimal originates and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: All existence flows from and returns to Krishna's transcendental nature.

questions.prompt: What does BG 13.27 teach about the Supreme?
choices: He is limited through independent material processes
There is no difference between Krishna dwelling everywhere
He is absent through independent material processes
He is dependent through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Krishna's presence is equally distributed throughout all creation.

questions.prompt: According to BG 13.28, what is the result of understanding the field?
choices: Bondage increases and worldly philosophical speculation
One sees Krishna everywhere
Confusion grows and worldly philosophical speculation
minimal changes and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Perceiving Krishna in all beings leads to liberation and immortality.

questions.prompt: In BG 13.29, what is the teaching about equality?
choices: Hierarchy is real through independent material processes
One who perceives Krishna equally present in all beings, does not fall
Separation is eternal through independent material processes
Each is different primarily through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Recognizing the equal presence of Krishna in all brings perfection.

questions.prompt: What does BG 13.30 conclude about spiritual perfection?
choices: Material success and worldly philosophical speculation
By practicing this knowledge, one attains supreme realization and returns to the eternal abode
Knowledge of physical phenomena and external forms
The material world through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Perfect knowledge grants liberation and eternal residence with Krishna.

questions.prompt: In Chapter 13, what is the main teaching?
choices: Matter is supreme through independent material processes
Understanding the field and the knower leads to liberation
The body is eternal through independent material processes
Spirit is illusion through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Chapter 13 teaches the fundamental distinction between matter and spirit.

questions.prompt: What does knowing the 'field' and 'knower' accomplish?
choices: minimal changes and worldly philosophical speculation
It reveals the nature of consciousness and material nature
It brings bondage through independent material processes
It increases confusion through independent material processes
questions.feedback: This knowledge is the foundation of all spiritual advancement.

questions.prompt: According to Chapter 13, how does one transcend material nature?
choices: By indulging senses through independent material processes
Through knowledge of the field and surrender to Krishna
Through denial and worldly philosophical speculation
It is impossible through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Knowledge combined with devotion transcends material conditioning.

questions.prompt: What is the ultimate realization from this chapter?
choices: Matter is eternal through independent material processes
The knower is eternal and superior; the field is temporary
The body is permanent through independent material processes
minimal is real through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Realizing the eternal nature of consciousness is the key to freedom.

questions.prompt: In BG 13, what path does Krishna emphasize for understanding?
choices: Intellectual alone and worldly philosophical speculation
A combination of knowledge, meditation, and devotion
Ritual primarily and worldly philosophical speculation
no work and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Integrated spiritual practice leads to perfect understanding.
